definition: senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
title of a Daoist priest/revered master
to revere the master and his teaching

sentences.english: Shouji respect, the collective interest, good moral character, learning the correct attitude.
sentences.chinese: 尊师守纪，关心集体，品德优良，学习态度端正。

sentences.english: At the same time, we have to drink from the source, respecting teachers, Thanksgiving.
sentences.chinese: 同时，我们还要饮水思源，尊师感恩。

sentences.english: It shows that the tradition of "honouring the teacher and respecting his teaching" is still deeply ingrained among Chinese teachers here.
sentences.chinese: 这反映了华文教育界尊师重道的传统依然根深蒂固。

sentences.english: We should creat a social environment in which teachers are respected, and education is valued, knowledge sought and learning stressed.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该创造一个尊师重教，求知好学的社会氛围。

sentences.english: But it is still more marvelous to have met my venerated Master, Mila.
sentences.chinese: 但是更叫人不可思议的是我见到了尊师米拉。

definition: founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
the younger generation/those who come after
lit. teacher for one day, father for ever (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 ri4 wei2 shi1 , zhong1 shen1 wei2 fu4

definition: used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
term of respect for your teacher's wife
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate
